title: Simple harmonic motion - statement about SHM

content.question: Which of the following must be true for an object undergoing simple harmonic motion?

choices.label: The force exerted on the object is in the direction of the object’s displacement.
The magnitude of the force exerted on the object is proportional to the object’s displacement from equilibrium.
The magnitude of the acceleration of the object is at its maximum value when the object is at its equilibrium position.
The speed of the object is at its maximum value when the object is at its maximum displacement.

content.answer: The magnitude of the force exerted on the object is proportional to the object’s displacement from equilibrium.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
